```markdown
# semver - The semantic versioner for npm

This is the README for the `semver` module.

## Installation

```bash
npm install semver
```

## Usage

**As a Node.js module:**

```javascript
const semver = require('semver');

semver.valid('1.2.3'); // '1.2.3'
semver.valid('a.b.c'); // null
semver.clean('  =v1.2.3   '); // '1.2.3'
semver.satisfies('1.2.3', '1.x || >=2.5.0 || 5.0.0 - 7.2.3'); // true
semver.gt('1.2.3', '9.8.7'); // false
semver.lt('1.2.3', '9.8.7'); // true
semver.minVersion('>=1.0.0'); // '1.0.0'
semver.valid(semver.coerce('v2')); // '2.0.0'
semver.valid(semver.coerce('42.6.7.9.3-alpha')); // '42.6.7'
```

**As a command-line utility:**

```
$ semver -h

A JavaScript implementation of the https://semver.org/ specification
Copyright Isaac Z. Schlueter

Usage: semver [options] <version> [<version> [...]]
Prints valid versions sorted by SemVer precedence

Options:
-r, --range <range>  Print versions that match the specified range.
-i, --increment [<level>] Increment a version by the specified level.
    Level can be: major, minor, patch, premajor, preminor, prepatch, or prerelease.
    Default level is 'patch'. Only one version may be specified.
--preid <identifier> Identifier to be used to prefix premajor, preminor, prepatch or prerelease version increments.
-l, --loose Interpret versions and ranges loosely.
-p, --include-prerelease Always include prerelease versions in range matching.
-c, --coerce Coerce a string into SemVer if possible (does not imply --loose).
--rtl Coerce version strings right to left.
--ltr Coerce version strings left to right (default).
```


## Versions

A version is defined according to the [semver.org specification](https://semver.org/).  Leading `=` or `v` characters are ignored.


## Ranges

A version range specifies a set of versions that satisfy it.  A comparator consists of an operator and a version.  Supported operators include: `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`, and `=`.  Whitespace separates comparators to form a comparator set (satisfied by the intersection of comparators), and `||` separates comparator sets (satisfied by the union).

### Prerelease Tags

Prerelease versions (e.g., `1.2.3-alpha.1`) are only considered in matching a range if the range itself includes a prerelease tag.

### Advanced Range Syntax

#### Hyphen Ranges (`X.Y.Z - A.B.C`)

Defines an inclusive set of versions.  `1.2.3 - 2.3.4` is equivalent to `>=1.2.3 <=2.3.4`.  Partial versions are handled appropriately.


#### X-Ranges (`1.2.x`, `1.X`, `1.2.*`, `*`)

`x`, `X`, or `*` may substitute for a number in the version.  `1.x.x` is equivalent to `>=1.0.0 <2.0.0`.


#### Tilde Ranges (`~1.2.3`, `~1.2`, `~1`)

Allows patch-level changes if a minor version is specified; allows minor-level changes if not.  `~1.2.3` is equivalent to `>=1.2.3 <1.3.0`.


#### Caret Ranges (`^1.2.3`, `^0.2.5`, `^0.0.4`)

Allows changes that don't modify the left-most non-zero digit in the version.  `^1.2.3` is equivalent to `>=1.2.3 <2.0.0`.


## Functions

The `semver` module exports various functions for working with versions and ranges.  See the [official documentation](https://github.com/npm/node-semver) for details on each function.

## Comparison

Functions are provided for comparing versions (`gt`, `gte`, `lt`, `lte`, `eq`, `neq`, `cmp`, `compare`, `rcompare`, `compareBuild`).  These functions are crucial for sorting and checking version relationships.


## Coercion

The `coerce` function attempts to convert a string into a valid SemVer version.  The `clean` function cleans a string to be a valid semver version if possible.


## Exported Modules

The `semver` module exports different parts of its functionality.  See the [official documentation](https://github.com/npm/node-semver) for detailed information on individual modules.
```
